commit_message:
Don't add public network to all nodes

In default setup we should not assign public ip to all nodes.
Just to ones with controller role. So we filter out public ip
network for nodes that should not have it.

Change-Id: I2a9ea4d06cc1ba15bad20b817659b7539827472a
Closes-Bug: 1415552
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/56/292356/31 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: should_have_public = objects.Node.\ should_have_public_with_ip(node.cluster) for ng in ngs if not (not should_have_public and ng.name != consts.NETWORKS.public)],

subject: Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 19:10:01.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/designate_install_apt.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/designate_install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate/commit/66143b80f6a306b525c10134ab531b9bd9026033', 'message': 'Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables

Ansible 2.2 will not allow "bare" variable references
in with_* loops. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/porting_guide_2.0.html#deprecated

Change-Id: I65cbf9de6869bebd48570d90c768ac5ba214b44d
'}]
commit_message:
Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables

Ansible 2.2 will not allow "bare" variable references
in with_* loops. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/porting_guide_2.0.html#deprecated
for details.

Change-Id: I65cbf9de6869bebd48570d90c768ac5ba214b44d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate refs/changes/35/308535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with_items: "{{ designate_requires_pip_packages }}" with_items: "{{ designate_pip_packages }}" with_items: "{{ designate_pip_packages }}"
deleted_lines: with_items: - "{{ designate_requires_pip_packages }}" with_items: designate_pip_packages with_items: - "{{ designate_pip_packages }}"

subject: Fix usage of oslo.db exceptions in db.sqlalchemy.api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 14:58:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/9b34d49154a519ec23494400c61a304b86f56b5c', 'message': "Fix usage of oslo.db exceptions in db.sqlalchemy.api

.message attribute of InvalidSortKey exception has been deprecated
and is going to be removed soon (oslo.db used to provide one for this
particular exception class, but with removal of .message attribute
from the base Exception class in Py3k it's going to be removed
from oslo.db too).

Change-Id: I5dd4b1e0109cf2f2f33b8c203b05337ea9ae363d
Closes-Bug: #1542961
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of oslo.db exceptions in db.sqlalchemy.api

.message attribute of InvalidSortKey exception has been deprecated
and is going to be removed soon (oslo.db used to provide one for this
particular exception class, but with removal of .message attribute
from the base Exception class in Py3k it's going to be removed
from oslo.db too).

Change-Id: I5dd4b1e0109cf2f2f33b8c203b05337ea9ae363d
Closes-Bug: #1542961
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/35/277435/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.Invalid(reason=str(exc)) raise exception.Invalid(reason=str(exc))

subject: Add backup import from file to cinderclient api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-21 07:10:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/dde5df0be063158c01aff5abb7a670a41d601f02', 'message': 'Add backup import from file to cinderclient api

In order to be able to restore a volume backup on another
block storage, we need a command that will enable to import
a backup into the db from backup_metadata file.

Implements: blueprint cinder-backup-import-record-from-backup-metadata-file
Depends-on: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f

Conflicts:
	cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py

commit_message:
Add backup import from file to cinderclient api

In order to be able to restore a volume backup on another
block storage, we need a command that will enable to import
a backup into the db from backup_metadata file.

Implements: blueprint cinder-backup-import-record-from-backup-metadata-file
Depends-on: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f

Conflicts:
	cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py
	cinderclient/v3/shell.py

Change-Id: I549ece2276d565415e28a0b0a16f96b3cbb30390

added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD======= from json import dump import mock from os.path import join from shutil import rmtree from tempfile import mkdtemp >>>>>>> f24e10e... Add backup import from file to cinderclient api<<<<<<< HEAD ======= def test_record_import_from_file(self): try: tmpdir = mkdtemp() filename = 'fake' path = join(tmpdir, filename) extra_metadata = {'extra_metadata': {'encode_record': 'URL_STRING', 'driver_name': 'fake.driver'}} with open(path, 'w') as tmp: dump(extra_metadata, tmp) except Exception: rmtree(tmpdir) raise self.run_command('backup-import-record-from-backup-metadata-file %s' % path) expected = {'backup-record': {'backup_service': 'fake.driver', 'backup_url': 'URL_STRING'}} self.assert_called('POST', '/backups/import_record', expected) rmtree(tmpdir) >>>>>>> f24e10e... Add backup import from file to cinderclient api

commit_message:
Update os_neutron to handle newton migrations

Performing initial neutron migrations currently works, but applying
subsequent migrations will fail due to the role attempting to apply
mitaka migrations.  This update moves tasks/neutron_db_setup.yml
over to newton and updates library/neutron_migrations_facts to be
aware of newton migrations.

Change-Id: I56416f21144f0cdb9e096576922fd441bc7f9cb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/91/308291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: release: neutonRELEASES = ['neuton', 'mitaka', 'liberty']

commit_message:
Remove pool config from designate.conf

Pools, targets, etc. are now configured via a pools.yaml file and
imported with designate-manage.  This change updates our
designate.conf.j2 to reflect this.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301868/ for the associated
upstream designate change.

Change-Id: I8af0859c70e00d3e7e2ba1391d7689b4c807da0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate refs/changes/24/307224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix Heartbeats stop when time is changed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 20:59:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service/commit/613577e586ebc8d85b998a09b4b1a6dc1b05cf80', 'message': '[WIP] Override clock in eventlet hubs

Change-Id: I4c1cf223e9f6faa1e6dcaf432be1aa709072a343
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 21:28:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service/commit/9d30680f4493228f18309d274e3717348a206d88', 'message': '[WIP] Override clock in eventlet hubs

Change-Id: I4c1cf223e9f6faa1e6dcaf432be1aa709072a343
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-02 00:09:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service/commit/d3a0ade8f1baa31402cc3e730e37fd323dd6967c', 'message': "Fix Heartbeats stop when time is changed

eventlet's hub mechanism defaults to using time.time for figuring
out how long to sleep, when to wake up etc:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/eventlet/hubs/epolls.py#L37
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/eventlet/hubs/hub.py#L344

So if you mess with the system time, anything using loopingcall
will stop working. Best example as described in the bug is
`nova-manage service list` which fails for some services when
the clock is advanced.

If we use a monotonic timer, then we can get past this problem.
In this review we use the EVENTLET_HUB hook to specify
a custom Hub. In our custom Hub, we just delegate to the
existing hub mechanism (get_default_hub()) to create an
instance of the Hub and override the clock with one based
on monotonic.

Note that use_hub() mechanism will not work because that sets
the Hub just for the current thread and will not work for other
threads that may be started later. In order to set this
environment variable early, we set it in the __init__.py so
anyone who uses oslo service will enable this support just
by a simple import referencing anything in oslo.service

Closes-Bug: 1510234
Change-Id: I4c1cf223e9f6faa1e6dcaf432be1aa709072a343
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-02 00:17:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service/commit/891a7399d1e3d95643af65b46271346972fc85c5', 'message': "Fix Heartbeats stop when time is changed

commit_message:
Fix Heartbeats stop when time is changed

eventlet's hub mechanism defaults to using time.time for figuring
out how long to sleep, when to wake up etc:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/eventlet/hubs/epolls.py#L37
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/eventlet/hubs/hub.py#L344

So if you mess with the system time, anything using loopingcall
will stop working. Best example as described in the bug is
`nova-manage service list` which fails for some services when
the clock is advanced.

If we use a monotonic timer, then we can get past this problem.
In this review we use the EVENTLET_HUB hook to specify
a custom Hub. In our custom Hub, we just delegate to the
existing hub mechanism (get_default_hub()) to create an
instance of the Hub and override the clock with one based
on monotonic.

Note that use_hub() mechanism will not work because that sets
the Hub just for the current thread and will not work for other
threads that may be started later. In order to set this
environment variable early, we set it in the __init__.py so
anyone who uses oslo service will enable this support just
by a simple import referencing anything in oslo.service

Co-Authored-By: Victor Stinner <vstinner@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1510234
Change-Id: I4c1cf223e9f6faa1e6dcaf432be1aa709072a343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service refs/changes/38/286838/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventlet LOG.info('>>>> eventlet.hubs.get_default_hub() : %r', eventlet.hubs.get_default_hub()) LOG.info('>>>> eventlet.hubs.get_hub() : %r', eventlet.hubs.get_hub()) LOG.info('>>>> eventlet.hubs.get_hub().clock : %r', eventlet.hubs.get_hub().clock)

subject: Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables

commit_message:
Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables

Ansible 2.2 will not allow "bare" variable references
in with_* loops. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/porting_guide_2.0.html#deprecated
for details.

Change-Id: Ia50dc962f19de2d04fa0bf483cff9cd2c7d79f7d

commit_message:
Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables

Ansible 2.2 will not allow "bare" variable references
in with_* loops. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/porting_guide_2.0.html#deprecated
for details.

Change-Id: Icd072922773674e509d2d49cee9ba348e52e23ec

commit_message:
Make sure Cisco drivers are documented on IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER

Recently support was added to ironic devstack to support the Cisco
Ironic drivers, however the comment above IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER
wasn't updated to reflect this has part of that change, this is a
follow up patch making sure that documention is completed.

Change-Id: Iea48abf911345f0b017648f368e3d61fb3cc63d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/68/305868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Document how to run the tempest tests

This patch is extending the developer quick-start guide to include
information about how one can run the integration tests (tempest) against
a running devstack cloud (the setup for such a cloud is already part of
the documentation).

The patch also removes the information about how to run tests from the
ironic_tempest_plugin/README.rst file and add a link pointing to our
documentation.

Change-Id: I6aeb3a4fa735ff08cbb62b0b15cf95be57d1a308
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/307695/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================== Running Tempest tests ===================== After `Deploying Ironic with DevStack`_ one might want to run integration tests against the running cloud. The Tempest project is the project that offers an integration test suit for OpenStack. First, navigate to Tempest directory:: cd /opt/stack/tempest To run all tests from the Ironic plug-in, execute the following command:: tox -e all-plugin -- ironic To limit the amount of tests that you would like to run, you can use a regex; for instance to limit the run to a single test the following command can be used:: tox -e all-plugin -- ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.test_baremetal_basic_ops

follow the implementation of keystone.

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.

Related-bug #1465086
Change-Id: Ia58b02521fa068db123e888d921a61dac4f1743e

compute").
These services are provided by puppet-nova,

Change-Id: I0b1658d8d19dcb1b1115712d5e9314d3b45bc6ba
(cherry picked from commit 2fb8cf3c63767ec100076cddb932449d6b6781da)

commit_message:
Ensure libvirt-services running on Ubuntu

On Ubuntu services don't autostart when
"nova-compute" package being installed (due to
"tweaks::ubuntu_service_override").
This behaviour affects services from auto-
installed packages (dependencies for "nova-
compute").
These services are provided by puppet-nova,
so they should be ensured by Puppet.

Closes-bug: #1569378

Change-Id: I0b1658d8d19dcb1b1115712d5e9314d3b45bc6ba
(cherry picked from commit 2fb8cf3c63767ec100076cddb932449d6b6781da)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/55/308455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should manage libvirt-services under Ubuntu UCA' do if facts[:os_package_type] == 'ubuntu' should contain_service('virtlogd').that_comes_before('Service[libvirt]') should contain_service('virtlockd').that_comes_before('Service[libvirt]') end end

subject: Fix "Not applying Firewall rules immediately" problem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 07:16:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/09d447a890160e8b4e8b5380be408040670c7a25', 'message': 'Fix "Not applying Firewall rules immediately" problem

Currently, when we apply the firewall rules to a router, these firewall
rules are not applied immediately. It means that the connections are
still ACCEPTED with new changed DENY/REJECT rules.
This patch adds codes to remove the conntrack entries which are created
whenever the connections are established and let the connections still
ACCEPTED with new changed DENY/REJECT rules.

Change-Id: I8d149d3cb0c8cbca2211446b082fcfcda93e2b19
Closes-Bug: #1474279
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-04 07:19:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/0dd587c078f794ff88f4a46a225969e380228a35', 'message': 'Fix "Not applying Firewall rules immediately" problem

Currently, when we apply the firewall rules to a router, these firewall
rules are not applied immediately. It means that the connections are
still ACCEPTED with new changed DENY/REJECT rules.
This patch adds codes to remove the conntrack entries which are created
whenever the connections are established and let the connections still
ACCEPTED with new changed DENY/REJECT rules. When the conntrack entries
are deleted, the connections with new changed DENY/REJECT rules will be
closed.

Change-Id: I8d149d3cb0c8cbca2211446b082fcfcda93e2b19
Closes-Bug: #1474279

commit_message:
Fix "Not applying Firewall rules immediately" problem

This patch removes the conntrack entries of the established
connection when the firewall updates its rules.

Change-Id: I8d149d3cb0c8cbca2211446b082fcfcda93e2b19
Closes-Bug: #1474279

added_lines: from neutron.agent.linux import utils as linux_utils self.pre_firewall = None self.execute = linux_utils.execute self._remove_conntrack_new_firewall(agent_mode, apply_list, firewall) self.pre_firewall = dict(firewall) self.pre_firewall = None if self.pre_firewall: self._remove_conntrack_updated_firewall(agent_mode, apply_list, self.pre_firewall, firewall) else: self._remove_conntrack_new_firewall(agent_mode, apply_list, firewall) self.pre_firewall = dict(firewall) #self._remove_conntrack(firewall, ipt_if_prefix) #self.pre_firewall = firewalL def _find_changed_rules(self, pre_firewall, firewall): """Find the rules changed between the current firewall and the updating rule """ changed_rules = [] fw_rules_list = firewall['firewall_rule_list'] pre_fw_rules_list = pre_firewall['firewall_rule_list'] for pre_fw_rule in pre_fw_rules_list: for fw_rule in fw_rules_list: if (pre_fw_rule.get('id') == fw_rule.get('id') and cmp(pre_fw_rule, fw_rule) != 0): changed_rules.append(pre_fw_rule) changed_rules.append(fw_rule) return changed_rules def _find_removed_rules(self, pre_firewall, firewall): removed_rules = [] fw_rules_list = firewall['firewall_rule_list'] pre_fw_rules_list = pre_firewall['firewall_rule_list'] fw_rule_ids = [] for fw_rule in fw_rules_list: fw_rule_ids.append(fw_rule.get('id')) for pre_fw_rule in pre_fw_rules_list: if pre_fw_rule.get('id') not in fw_rule_ids: removed_rules.append(pre_fw_rule) return removed_rules def _find_new_rules(self, pre_firewall, firewall): return self._find_removed_rules(firewall, pre_firewall) def _get_conntrack_cmd_from_rule(self, ipt_mgr, rule=None): prefixcmd = ['ip', 'netns', 'exec'] + [ipt_mgr.namespace] cmd = ['conntrack', '-D'] if rule: conntrack_filter = self._get_conntrack_filter_from_rule(rule) exec_cmd = prefixcmd + cmd + conntrack_filter else: exec_cmd = prefixcmd + cmd return exec_cmd def _remove_conntrack_by_cmd(self, cmd): if cmd: try: self.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True, extra_ok_codes=[1]) except RuntimeError: LOG.exception( _LE("Failed execute conntrack command %s"), str(cmd)) def _remove_conntrack_new_firewall(self, agent_mode, apply_list, firewall): """Remove conntrack when create new firewall""" routers_list = list(set(apply_list)) for router_info in routers_list: ipt_if_prefix_list = self._get_ipt_mgrs_with_if_prefix( agent_mode, router_info) for ipt_if_prefix in ipt_if_prefix_list: ipt_mgr = ipt_if_prefix['ipt'] cmd = self._get_conntrack_cmd_from_rule(ipt_mgr) self._remove_conntrack_by_cmd(cmd) def _remove_conntrack_updated_firewall(self, agent_mode, apply_list, pre_firewall, firewall): """Remove conntrack when updated firewall""" router_list = list(set(apply_list)) for router_info in router_list: ipt_if_prefix_list = self._get_ipt_mgrs_with_if_prefix( agent_mode, router_info) for ipt_if_prefix in ipt_if_prefix_list: ipt_mgr = ipt_if_prefix['ipt'] ch_rules = self._find_changed_rules(pre_firewall, firewall) i_rules = self._find_new_rules(pre_firewall, firewall) r_rules = self._find_removed_rules(pre_firewall, firewall) removed_conntrack_rules_list = ch_rules + i_rules + r_rules for rule in removed_conntrack_rules_list: cmd = self._get_conntrack_cmd_from_rule(ipt_mgr, rule) self._remove_conntrack_by_cmd(cmd) def _get_conntrack_filter_from_rule(self, rule): """Get conntrack filter from rule. The key for get conntrack filter is protocol, destination_port and source_port. If we want to take more keys, add to the list. """ conntrack_filter = [] keys = [['-p', 'protocol'], ['--dport', 'destination_port'], ['--sport', 'source_port']] for key in keys: if rule.get(key[1]): conntrack_filter.append(key[0]) conntrack_filter.append(rule.get(key[1])) return conntrack_filter

commit_message:
Unify the timestamp of samples generated by polling agents

Many of the pollsters define the timestamp individually for each generated
sample, which should really be timestamping based on when the data was polled
and not when each sample is generated. We need to set the timestamp of the
polled data to the timestamp when the polling starts for unity.

Related-Bug: #1491509
Blueprint unify-timestamp-of-polled-data

Change-Id: If22980c9fdf81e1c76dcd4a9053daf88d7f89d18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/69/283969/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================ Unify the timestamp of samples generated by polling agents ============================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/unify-timestamp-of-polled-data Problem description =================== Many of the pollsters define the timestamp individually for each generated sample, which should really be timestamping based on when the data was polled and not when each sample is generated. We need to set the timestamp of the polled data to the timestamp when the polling starts for unity. This should save overhead of calculating timestamp each sample and also allow for easier grouping of polled data. Proposed change =============== Modify ceilometer.agent.manager.PollingTask.poll_and_notify method to set the timestamp of samples to the time when the data was polled:: # Get the timestamp when pollster starts to work polling_timestamp = self._get_current_timestamp() samples = pollster.obj.get_samples( manager=self.manager, cache=cache, resources=polling_resources ) for sample in samples: # Unify the timestamp of polled samples sample.set_timestamp(polling_timestamp) Drop all the timestamp generations when we build samples via pollsters, like: https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/6.0.0.0b2/ceilometer/image/glance.py#L113 Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Pipeline impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- Save overhead of calculating timestamp each sample. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <yuywz> Work Items ---------- Update ceilometer.agent.manager.PollingTask.poll_and_notify method. Drop all the timestamp generations when we build samples via pollsters. Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit test to test: The timestamp of samples generated during a polling cycle is unified. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== Originally reported as a bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1491509 Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/unify-timestamp-of-polled-data

commit_message:
Blacklist Routes 2.3.0

Routes 2.3.0 made an unintentional API break, which was fixed in
2.3.1.  Several (but not all) projects that rely on routes patched
around it.

Our constraints system protects us, lets be defnsive and signal to
downstream that 2.3.0 isn't a good idea.

NOTE: I011c234cf95ab5d5366ad299d04e2a51359c955a was proposed by amrith
but is currently Abandoned otherwise I'd use that Change-ID.

Change-Id: I797fe9f2b9802547519fe6ff3521d3c2c2f18d0d
Related-Bug: 1563028

fix samples references in security group files

This fixes the samples references in the security group files,
commenting out 2 that don't exist at all.

This drops the warnings to 145 against current master.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

commit_message:
Handle unconfigured interfaces for dhcp-all-ifaces

On ubuntu, if an interface exists but is unconfigured then ifquery
$iface will return 0 but no output. This will cause dhcp-all-interfaces
to not attempt to dhcp on that interface.

Change-Id: Ic1532728ae9ca6d759714392f727d25b814ef336
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/87/296187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ifquery $interface >/dev/null 2>&1; then if [ -z "$(ifquery $interface 2>&1)" ]; then return 1 else return 0 fi else return 1 fi

commit_message:
Really remove all interfaces in dhcp-all-ifaces

As the doc says, we want to remove all interfaces that come by default
in cloud images. Cloud images also come with an eth1 though, so lets
just remove all interfaces.

Change-Id: I49c74a3285e6a610ac723bdf976f3727d2736749

subject: Allow local/enabled panels to order relative to enabled panels
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 19:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/utils/settings.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ea92e735829ae4271fcbae932f69ffdbda268546', 'message': "Allow local/enabled panels to order relative to enabled panels

A dashboard enabled file in local/enabled is not able to appear before,
or inbetween any core panels.

The list of panels appears to be intended to be sorted by file name,
but all files in /enabled and always presented in the nav ahead of
any files from local/enabled, no matter the file name.

This appears to be a bug in util/settings.py that does an rsplit to
separate file name from path, but accidentally uses the full list of
split items, instead of just the file name.

For example, a file with __name__ of
'openstack_dashboard.enabled._1040_project_volumes_panel' splits into
['openstack_dashboard.enabled', '_1040_project_volumes_panel']. When
this list is fed to cmp(), it will always come before a panel in
local/enabled such as
['openstack_dashboard.local.enabled', '_0001_my_new_panel']

Change-Id: Ic169ccf0db1e04ec42fe999df6648117ce9efe84
Closes-Bug: 1567047
"}]
commit_message:
Allow local/enabled panels to order relative to enabled panels

A dashboard enabled file in local/enabled is not able to appear before,
or inbetween any core panels.

The list of panels appears to be intended to be sorted by file name,
but all files in /enabled and always presented in the nav ahead of
any files from local/enabled, no matter the file name.

This appears to be a bug in util/settings.py that does an rsplit to
separate file name from path, but accidentally uses the full list of
split items, instead of just the file name.

For example, a file with __name__ of
'openstack_dashboard.enabled._1040_project_volumes_panel' splits into
['openstack_dashboard.enabled', '_1040_project_volumes_panel']. When
this list is fed to cmp(), it will always come before a panel in
local/enabled such as
['openstack_dashboard.local.enabled', '_0001_my_new_panel']

Change-Id: Ic169ccf0db1e04ec42fe999df6648117ce9efe84
Closes-Bug: 1567047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/17/302417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: key=lambda c: c[1]['__name__'].rsplit('.', 1)[1])

commit_message:
Adds Mitaka production deployment usage data

subject: centos-minimal: Disable creation of eth0/eth1 interface scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 04:25:45.000000000', 'files': ['elements/centos-minimal/environment.d/10-centos-distro-name.bash', 'elements/fedora-minimal/README.rst', 'elements/centos-minimal/README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/5dcedda91d424a00769a5794e0d9ec6d8681e371', 'message': 'centos-minimal: Disable creation of eth0/eth1 interface scripts

In I3f1ffeb6de3b1f952292a144efab9554f7f99a5f I disabled creation of
the interface scripts for Fedora because there have "stable device
names" and so aren't likely to have an eth0 & eth1.

Having this on for centos-minimal has just bitten us when trying to
deploy this into openstack CI.  What's silly is that we are creating
the interfaces with this falg, but then the simple-init install goes
and removes the eth0 interface file [1].

This lead to the confusing situation of glean *not* bringing up eth1
on centos-minimal, because it was already configured for DHCP.

This is unnecessary and confusing.  Creating eth0 and eth1 statically
like this is really just aiming the gun right at your foot, because
these days interface names can change or be totally different.  The
only sane thing to do is to use a dynamic configuration element like
simple-init or cloud-init.  If you really want to opt in to creating
these, it should not be the default.

Thus disable creation of the default interfaces for centos-minimal
too.  I've updated the documentation to reflect what's going on.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/elements/simple-init/install.d/60-simple-init-remove-interfaces

Change-Id: Id57c016643f89c6c32646b817f8779cba1894655
'}]
commit_message:
centos-minimal: Disable creation of eth0/eth1 interface scripts

In I3f1ffeb6de3b1f952292a144efab9554f7f99a5f I disabled creation of
the interface scripts for Fedora because there have "stable device
names" and so aren't likely to have an eth0 & eth1.

Having this on for centos-minimal has just bitten us when trying to
deploy this into openstack CI.  What's silly is that we are creating
the interfaces with this falg, but then the simple-init install goes
and removes the eth0 interface file [1].

This lead to the confusing situation of glean *not* bringing up eth1
on centos-minimal, because it was already configured for DHCP.

This is unnecessary and confusing.  Creating eth0 and eth1 statically
like this is really just aiming the gun right at your foot, because
these days interface names can change or be totally different.  The
only sane thing to do is to use a dynamic configuration element like
simple-init or cloud-init.  If you really want to opt in to creating
these, it should not be the default.

Thus disable creation of the default interfaces for centos-minimal
too.  I've updated the documentation to reflect what's going on.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/elements/simple-init/install.d/60-simple-init-remove-interfaces

Change-Id: Id57c016643f89c6c32646b817f8779cba1894655
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/84/294384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: By default, `DIB_YUM_MINIMAL_CREATE_INTERFACES` is disabled. If you wish to create sample `/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth[0|1]` scripts to enable `eth0` and `eth1` via DHCP set this to `1`. You probably do not want this, but would want to use something that can dynamically configure the network such as `cloud-init`, `glean` or `network-manager`.
deleted_lines: By default, `DIB_YUM_MINIMAL_CREATE_INTERFACES` is set to enable the creation of `/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth[0|1]` scripts to enable DHCP on the `eth0` & `eth1` interfaces. If you do not have these interfaces, or if you are using something else to setup the network such as cloud-init, glean or network-manager, you would want to set this to `0`.

commit_message:
Break reference cycle between ResourceRegistry and ResourceInfo

ResourceInfo should hold only a weak reference to the ResourceRegistry
it is held in, otherwise there is a cycle that means the entire registry
has to wait for garbage collection in order to be deallocated.

Change-Id: I708aa1e9bac696eb16e9ef21089ca6e14e84e067
Partial-Bug: #1570974
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/42/308542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import weakref self._registry = weakref.ref(registry) @property def registry(self): return self._registry()

subject: Break reference cycle between Environment and ResourceRegistry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 19:25:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/environment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/ec5e5c57a2f084ede7626df57426f9b69adf3541', 'message': 'Break reference cycle between Environment and ResourceRegistry

The commit 08431c7c0601f64e6f0477dd502bf912eba8529b added a reference to
the Environment object from the ResourceRegistry object, which is itself
an attribute of the environment. This causes a reference cycle that
means that the environment and everything referenced by it (including
the potentially very large files dict) will only be deallocated when it
is garbage collected since the reference counts will never hit zero.
This has probably been contributing substantially to memory
fragmentation.

Change-Id: Ib251b5f5ffc07fe1a06f5e44124024831d4ba1b2
Partial-Bug: #1570974
'}]
commit_message:
Break reference cycle between Environment and ResourceRegistry

The commit 08431c7c0601f64e6f0477dd502bf912eba8529b added a reference to
the Environment object from the ResourceRegistry object, which is itself
an attribute of the environment. This causes a reference cycle that
means that the environment and everything referenced by it (including
the potentially very large files dict) will only be deallocated when it
is garbage collected since the reference counts will never hit zero.
This has probably been contributing substantially to memory
fragmentation.

Change-Id: Ib251b5f5ffc07fe1a06f5e44124024831d4ba1b2
Partial-Bug: #1570974
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/41/308541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def generate_class_from_template(name, data, env): props, attrs = TemplateResource.get_schemas(tmpl, env.param_defaults)

commit_message:
Move selinux restore to end of finalise

After a bit of spelunking, I90d0c96d5659326ba67d6119b96d9a4113adf7fe
was the original change that introduced the setfiles here rather than
autorelabel at boot time.

Touching the autorelabel file probably makes sense somewhere low, but
when we start relabling the file system we really should be doing that
as late as possible so we fix up everything that has come before.
Move this to 90 to capture this.

Change-Id: Iae0afe850f52ec3b59c49507fa9bbcc1c8f8cfa1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/28/308128/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Align multiple lines in tox

This commit aligns multiple lines in tox for visual consistency.
I fixed them to 4 white spaces because the tox example[1] shows 4 white
spaces indentation.

[1] http://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html

Change-Id: I4f3b9c5c4982a0e96bb120ce8546dd48b0fa8a4b

commit_message:
Clarify the help text for error_wait_time

The help text for error_wait_time is identical to stack_action_timeout
and does not indicate what it actually controls.

Change-Id: I1e7eeb3586e70b668534ed2fd6c8a45ec4c625fd

subject: Add other virt services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-16 02:41:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/0637afc953fc67d82c8cb0a876ffe5fb0357dffe', 'message': 'Add other virt services

This change adds the management of virtlockd and virtlogd services
to the nova::compute::libvirt. These services are actually required
for nova to be able to communicate correctly with libvirt.  Virtlogd
is a debian specific service that is usually started automoatically on
install. However if you disable that or some how prevent it from
running, then it may interfere with nova.  We should explicitly
manage them sinve they are required.

Change-Id: I52c6609e547fa50dccb4b31b9d93748b2b02dee0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-16 15:10:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/add0996a91a5506bb6dbf3a87371ae541d29b4fe', 'message': 'Add other virt services

This change adds the management of virtlockd and virtlogd services
to the nova::compute::libvirt. These services are actually required
for nova to be able to communicate correctly with libvirt.  Virtlogd
is an Ubuntu specific service that is usually started automoatically
on install. However if you disable that or some how prevent it from
running, then it may interfere with nova.  We should explicitly

commit_message:
Add other virt services

This change adds the management of virtlockd and virtlogd services
to the nova::compute::libvirt. These services are actually required
for nova to be able to communicate correctly with libvirt.  Virtlockd
exists for RedHat and Ubuntu but is not currently available under
Debian. Virtlogd is Ubuntu specific service that is usually started
automatically on install of the libvirt package. However if you
disable that or some how prevent it from running, then it may
interfere with nova.  We should explicitly manage them since they
are required.

Change-Id: I52c6609e547fa50dccb4b31b9d93748b2b02dee0

added_lines: # [*virtlock_service_name*] # (optional) virtlock service name. # Defaults to $::nova::params::virtlock_service_name # # [*virtlog_service_name*] # (optional) virtlog service name. # Defaults to $::nova::params::virtlog_service_name # $virtlock_service_name = $::nova::params::virtlock_service_name, $virtlog_service_name = $::nova::params::virtlog_service_name, if $virtlock_service_name { service { 'virtlockd': ensure => running, enable => true, name => $virtlock_service_name, provider => $::nova::params::special_service_provider, require => Package['libvirt'] } } if $virtlog_service_name { service { 'virtlogd': ensure => running, enable => true, name => $virtlog_service_name, provider => $::nova::params::special_service_provider, require => Package['libvirt'] } }

drop it in manifests.

commit_message:
Don't declare the service when service_enable is false

In environments using neutron-vpn-agent, the neutron-l3-agent package
may not be installed ( by setting package_ensure to false ). The
l3-agent service is always declared, even if service_enable is set to
false, which will cause puppet to try and check the status of the
service and generate failures because the init script is missing. This
commit makes the service declaration dependent on service_enable being
set to true, and modifies the spec tests to reflect this.

Change-Id: Ib223999ab3ed3e83f42e96ad91a0728681c377b2
Closes-bug: #1571697
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/79/307879/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with manage_service as true' do params.merge!(:manage_service => true) it 'configures neutron l3 agent service' do is_expected.to contain_service('neutron-l3').with( :name => platform_params[:l3_agent_service], :enable => true, :ensure => 'running', :require => 'Class[Neutron]', :tag => 'neutron-service', ) is_expected.to contain_service('neutron-l3').that_subscribes_to('Package[neutron]')
deleted_lines: it 'configures neutron l3 agent service' do is_expected.to contain_service('neutron-l3').with( :name => platform_params[:l3_agent_service], :enable => true, :ensure => 'running', :require => 'Class[Neutron]', :tag => 'neutron-service', ) is_expected.to contain_service('neutron-l3').that_subscribes_to('Package[neutron]') end context 'with manage_service as false' do params.merge!(:manage_service => false) it 'should not start/stop service' do is_expected.to contain_service('neutron-l3').without_ensure

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 19:32:39.000000000', 'files': ['app/styles/_openstack-health.scss'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/7beb8fdf230b6aa345f2a24cf6dce5d668f9c1a6', 'message': "Fix alignment of group addons in panel controls

Due to the way we added support for advanced controls in panel
headers, some of the alignment tweaks normally made to input groups

"}]
commit_message:
Fix alignment of group addons in panel controls

Due to the way we added support for advanced controls in panel
headers, some of the alignment tweaks normally made to input groups
and addons weren't being applied properly to our panels. This adds
new CSS rules with an equivalent effect so input group addons are
properly attached to any addons, removing any odd gaps or rounded
corners that shouldn't exist.

Change-Id: I70252b95fd675393f81cd81cb2fa0ac2ff9824b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/48/306048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .input-group-addon:first-child { position: relative; left: 2px; * { position: relative; left: -1px; } } .input-group-addon:first-child { position: relative; left: 2px; width: 1px; * { position: relative; left: -1px; } & + input { border-bottom-left-radius: 0; border-top-left-radius: 0; } }

commit_message:
Workaround broken nodepool to unblock gate

Sed and check the length of the IP addresses in the private list.
If none found, copy the public to the private.

Change-Id: I05e4798aa301e022de7d5097d503d8213f2b66a8
Closes-Bug: #1571275
(cherry picked from commit f442319b19b641d5ad45816dfea5db234f21e93c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/40/308340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(sdake): This works around broken nodepool on systems with only one # private interface # The big regex checks for IP addresses in the file function setup_workaround_broken_nodepool { if [[ `grep -E -o "(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)" /etc/nodepool/node_private | wc -l` -eq 0 ]]; then cp /etc/nodepool/node /etc/nodepool/node_private cp /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private fi } setup_workaround_broken_nodepool

ipsec.conf and ipsec.secrets, and then compare the configurations
when restart, if no config changes. Restart can be skipped.

Note: this change is DocImpact

Change-Id: I5a7fae909cb56721bd7e4d42999356c7f7464358
Closes-Bug: #1571455
'}]
commit_message:
Openswan/Libreswan: Check config changes before restart

Currently, when neutron-vpn-agent restart, all the pluto process in
router ns will be restarted too. But actually this is not required
and will impact the vpn traffic. In this patch, we keep a backup for
ipsec.conf and ipsec.secrets, and then compare the configurations
when restart, if no config changes. Restart can be skipped.

Note: this change is DocImpact

Change-Id: I5a7fae909cb56721bd7e4d42999356c7f7464358
Closes-Bug: #1571455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/99/306899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import filecmp deprecated_group='libreswan'), cfg.BoolOpt('restart_check_config', default=False, help=_('Enable this flag to avoid from unnecessary restart'), deprecated_group='libreswan') def _copy_configs(self): if not cfg.CONF.pluto.restart_check_config: return config_file_name = self._get_config_filename('ipsec.conf') if os.path.isfile(config_file_name): shutil.copyfile(config_file_name, config_file_name + '.old') config_file_name = self._get_config_filename('ipsec.secrets') if os.path.isfile(config_file_name): shutil.copyfile(config_file_name, config_file_name + '.old') def _config_changed(self): secrets_file = os.path.join( self.etc_dir, 'ipsec.secrets') config_file = os.path.join( self.etc_dir, 'ipsec.conf') if not os.path.isfile(secrets_file + '.old'): return True if not os.path.isfile(config_file + '.old'): return True if not filecmp.cmp(secrets_file, secrets_file + '.old'): return True if not filecmp.cmp(config_file, config_file + '.old'): return True return False def do_restart(self): def restart(self): """Wapper for do_restart""" if not cfg.CONF.pluto.restart_check_config: self.do_restart() return if self._config_changed(): self.do_restart() if cfg.CONF.pluto.restart_check_config: self._copy_configs()

subject: composable glance services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-20 02:03:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a2a1fcd48270c9410ea20e574b39cb46a0b355ed', 'message': 'Create Glance API and Glance Registry Roles

Adds new puppet and puppet pacemaker specific roles for
the Glance API and Registry. These services were implemented
individually so as to better align with docker containers
(once we get there).

For each implementation the puppet manifests for Glance API/Registry
configuration moves out of the overcloud_controller manifest
and into the glance specific role templates.

The Pacemaker templates extend the default roles and adds in
a few extra Hiera and manifest setting for Pacemaker. The
pacemaker::resource::service and pacemaker::constraint settings
for pacemaker are coupled (they apply to both roles) so only
the glance-api role includes those settings. (essentially
with pacemaker the glance-api and glance-registry roles
must be defined on the same server).

Change-Id: I00a8c916129af43cda225754eb10370289bb4b41

swap in the pacemaker specific puppet-tripleo profile instead.

the pacemaker varients of this service can't be split out...)

commit_message:
composable glance services

Adds new puppet and puppet pacemaker specific services for
Glance API and Glance Registry.

The Pacemaker templates extend the default glance services and
swap in the pacemaker specific puppet-tripleo profile instead.
In the case of pacemaker glance-registry there is no separate
puppet manifest so only the configuration parameters are maintained
there. (Due to the way the pacemaker glance constraints are written
the pacemaker varients of this service can't be split out...)

Depends-On: Ifc388f7058ccfff2818f531bcbc00c7179874bbc
Change-Id: I00a8c916129af43cda225754eb10370289bb4b41

commit_message:
Make tunnel_sync logging less verbose

The current status makes an info level message being logged
unconditionally every 2 seconds.

In order to clean up the logs in a default installation, use only debug
level for this message.

Change-Id: I270fbf2f0ba0af7fbdc224135dd7376e5c050dbc

commit_message:
Remove unused hz-array-field-directive

The hz-array-field directive provided some additional syntax
highlighting taking nested table like objects and displaying
them as a table. The output format was interesting, but we
commented it out because it wasn't quite right. This patch
removes the commented out code for that purpose.
It can be added back at a later point if desired.

Change-Id: I3b7d20f147aaccf291aa20b4081aec57e1a09ae8
Closes-Bug: 1565947

commit_message:
Improve unit test coverage

This patch adds unit tests to cover the following cases:
* Disable tracing of static methods
* Disable tracing of class methods

Change-Id: I16183c83b0dbf5ec974894c35bc77fd44bfe5455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/49/292849/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class FakeTraceStaticMethodBase(FakeTracedCls): def static_method(arg):@profiler.trace_cls("rpc", trace_static_methods=True) class FakeTraceStaticMethod(FakeTraceStaticMethodBase): pass @profiler.trace_cls("rpc") class FakeTraceStaticMethodSkip(FakeTraceStaticMethodBase): pass class FakeTraceClassMethodBase(FakeTracedCls): @classmethod def class_method(cls, arg): return arg @profiler.trace_cls("rpc") class FakeTraceClassMethodSkip(FakeTraceClassMethodBase): pass fake_cls = FakeTraceStaticMethod() self.assertEqual(25, fake_cls.static_method(25)) @mock.patch("osprofiler.profiler.stop") @mock.patch("osprofiler.profiler.start") def test_static_method_skip(self, mock_start, mock_stop): self.assertEqual(25, FakeTraceStaticMethodSkip.static_method(25)) self.assertFalse(mock_start.called) self.assertFalse(mock_stop.called) @mock.patch("osprofiler.profiler.stop") @mock.patch("osprofiler.profiler.start") def test_class_method_skip(self, mock_start, mock_stop): self.assertEqual("foo", FakeTraceClassMethodSkip.class_method("foo")) self.assertFalse(mock_start.called) self.assertFalse(mock_stop.called)
deleted_lines: @profiler.trace_cls("rpc") class FakeTraceStatic(FakeTracedCls): def method4(arg): fake_cls = FakeTraceStatic() self.assertEqual(25, fake_cls.method4(25))

commit_message:
use thread safe fnmatch

fnmatch is not thread safe in python <2.7.10, let's use the safe
one in oslo.utils

Change-Id: If3d480436506ecc5f3c2fcbd51ceaac59f2b7dec
ref: https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/fe12c34c39eb

commit_message:
Fix tests broken by novaclient 4.0.0 release

The release of python-novaclient 4.0.0 removed both volume_types
and volume_snapshots from the v2 namespace. Both of these data types
are supplied by cinder, but the Horizon test data was still populating
them in nova test data and the tests were using the nova values.

This patch removes the missing namespace references and replaces
the mocked test data with those mocked for cinder.

Additionally, the change exposed a rather broken test in the QoS
for volume_types test suite. This test has been fixed and improved
to exercise more branches.

This fix will unblock the gate for Horizon.

Closes-Bug: #1572246
(cherry picked from commit 5d6003971f1c41abecd19c40b1384f9efa5210de)

A merge conflict was resolved when cherry picking this change from the
master branch due to commit fd92d8ec59c2f4d91f4a1c5463d95d1237f07b21.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/tests.py

Change-Id: I9604cd4046a5ab1486373d0572ddf504d4691196

commit_message:
Fix typo in cinderclient shell

This patch fixes missing '.' in help messages and inconsistent formatting
in cinderclient shell:
+ Changing ". Admin only" to " (Admin only)"
+ Replacing ". Default=xxx" with "(Default=xxx)"

Change-Id: Ie3903ec1cbe12ad53d20da0bf96009c9fcd3e278

commit_message:
use thread safe fnmatch

aodh listener is a multi-thread scenario, but fnmatch is not thread
safe in python <2.7.10, let's use thread safe implementation in
oslo.utils.fnmatch.

Change-Id: I49af83ea1a7c43ae4962ecc70c173e8752199e38

commit_message:
cfg: do not add --version if not version provided

Currently some command line tools report --version but no version is
passed, meaning nothing is printed. Which is very confusing.

Change-Id: Ief864b1438dffd5d35001dcfa1e3f1bb99078b11

commit_message:
Make "make coreos" output moveable without sudo

The build_coreos_image.sh script outputs files owned by root because it
runs the make coreos, using sudo. This patch adds a couple of lines in
that script to ensure that the files created are useable without having to
use sudo after the script is finished.

** The coreos build post job requires this change **

Change-Id: Id462ac350940bd70b40e5ca76521ecf3e652f0e0

subject: Move inventory environment loading to function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 18:15:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/be04831aa8951f9aac23ea8b5769ed9e9bd2fcd7', 'message': 'Move inventory environment loading to function

Originally the inventory environment was loaded as part of the `main`
function. While this worked, it was difficult to isolate environment
information when using it for testing.

The loading process for the environment is now in a standalone function,
with basic tests around it.

In order to facilitate testing the `load_environment` function directly,
the Python path is altered in the test script to import the
dynamic_inventory.py script. This change is also useful for future tests
targeted at specific functions.

commit_message:
Move inventory environment loading to function

Originally the inventory environment was loaded as part of the `main`
function. While this worked, it was difficult to isolate environment
information when using it for testing.

The loading process for the environment is now in a standalone function,
with basic tests around it.

In order to facilitate testing the `load_environment` function directly,
the Python path is altered in the test script to import the
dynamic_inventory.py script. This change is also useful for future tests
targeted at specific functions.

Change-Id: Ic24a8bc068f39cbd56ec8563d7f0bb40690f63a3

Typo fix for memorized_getattr decorator

The memorized_getattr decorator name constains a 'memoized' typo.
Fixed that typo and corresponding decorator calls in test cases.

commit_message:
Enabled debug logging functionality for libvirt

When debug: True is set, libvirt doesn't extend its logging.
This commit extends the logging, following the practices listed
in http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/DebugLogs.

Log destination isn't changed.

Change-Id: I4f0c6794884d6a611ca2a4e6aefb279c5fa1816f
Closes-Bug: #1418586

commit_message:
Fixes unexpectedly passing functional test.

This fix allows all functional tests passing rather
then one unexpectedly passing:

test_bug_1541691.TestServerValidation.test_name_validation

The bug 1541691 was merged, however test never got updated.

Change-Id: I84597ad5f5ca9ef457f34769e3fe299b780acadd
Closes-Bug: 1570884
Related-Bug: 1541691
(cherry picked from commit 72a0a7c174f2ba0787defc10af6f67403a705647)

commit_message:
Downgrade network not found log in DHCP RPC

This is a normal occurence as networks are created and
deleted. It's not something that an operator should be
warned about.

Closes-Bug: #1554695
(cherry picked from commit 0db4ba3f855d84a3d7522aa17dc89c4792d2ef4a)

subject: DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/item_allocator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8810a2535b65346e215e58d646d1144ebc80a850', 'message': 'DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range

The current dvr_fip_ns.py file has FIP_LL_SUBNET configured
with a subnet prefixlen of /23 which only allows 255 pairs of
link-local addresses to be generated. If the number of routers
per-node increases beyond the 255 limit it raises an assertion.

This patch increases the link-local address cidr to be a /18
to allow for 8K routers. The new range was chosen to not
overlap with the original, allowing for in-place upgrades
without affecting existing routers.

Closes-Bug: #1562110
Change-Id: I6e11622ea9cc74b1d2428757f16aa0de504ac31a
(cherry picked from commit 7b1b8c2de57457c2ec1ed784165a3e10e24151cf)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range

The current dvr_fip_ns.py file has FIP_LL_SUBNET configured
with a subnet prefixlen of /23 which only allows 255 pairs of
link-local addresses to be generated. If the number of routers
per-node increases beyond the 255 limit it raises an assertion.

This patch increases the link-local address cidr to be a /18
to allow for 8K routers. The new range was chosen to not
overlap with the original, allowing for in-place upgrades
without affecting existing routers.

Closes-Bug: #1562110
Change-Id: I6e11622ea9cc74b1d2428757f16aa0de504ac31a
(cherry picked from commit 7b1b8c2de57457c2ec1ed784165a3e10e24151cf)

commit_message:
Update get_by_project_id on InstanceMappingList

The get_by_project_id method of InstanceMappingList was not previously
updated to account for backrefs being added. This fixes that, and brings
the actual method in line with the unit test. The method was broken
before but it was not exposed.

Change-Id: I5ca7549bdb1a91011494bc9eb64ca350ca275b54

commit_message:
Adjusting dependency to supply required var

The repo_build role depends upon galera_client
only to ensure the correct galera packages are
installed. See I6536993523f02ba49da741b9ea21535eb33fe402
for more details. As such, there is no need to create
the client config file.

Change-Id: I943da143300d869e486d9b7a15023650493bd9c4

subject: Conditionally apply pip_lock_down role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 20:09:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/bd444248e212fb22d6d95ce4ab14c79ee3491c13', 'message': 'Conditionally apply pip_lock_down role

This commit adds variable ``tempest_developer_mode`` and conditionally
applies pip_lock_down when ``tempest_developer_mode`` is false.  This
is necessary when installing tempest in a functional test.

commit_message:
Conditionally apply pip_lock_down role

This commit adds variable ``tempest_developer_mode`` and conditionally
applies pip_lock_down when ``tempest_developer_mode`` is false.  This
is necessary when installing tempest in a functional test.

By default, ``tempest_developer_mode`` will remain false so that the
default behaviour of the role is maintained.

Change-Id: I262fca0717520efb554ae83cb38d3b7f8d001abe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/59/308559/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - role: pip_lock_down when: - not tempest_developer_mode | bool

commit_message:
Ensure ZFS pool management is idempotent

As block device configuration is called from the
config-changed hook, it's vital that the code for
managing the zfs pool is idempotent.

Add a helper to query pool information and ensure
that the ZFS pool does not already exist before
attempting creation.

Change-Id: I4f4ad9c4cdb73b77e8b3a9367b81ec1566bacd59
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-lxd refs/changes/89/308489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if dev in check_zpool(): log('Device already exists for zfs. Skipping') return def check_zpool(): '''Determine if the zpool exists''' pools = [] zpools = check_output(['zpool', 'list', '-H']).splitlines() for l in zpools: l = l.decode('UTF-8') pools.append(l.split()[0]) return pools

commit_message:
Move db query to fetch down bindings under try/except

In case of intermittent DB failures router and network auto-rescheduling
tasks may fail due to error on fetching down bindings from db.
Need to put this queries under try/except to prevent unexpected exit.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/agentschedulers_db.py
	neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py
	neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py

Closes-Bug: #1546110
Change-Id: Id48e899a5b3d906c6d1da4d03923bdda2681cd92
(cherry picked from commit b6ec40cbf754de9d189f843cbddfca67d4103ee3)

commit_message:
Force testresources<2.0.0 outside of g-r

There exists a chicken'n'egg problem where we need to capp testresources
but we can't because testresources is messing up the gate.

Manually for that cap until we can land and release fixed packages.

Change-Id: Ieb2cf6c2a06ccd5d49f36fa2055e9087e33f17ca
Related-Bug: 1572417

commit_message:
Cast Int64 values to int, float in statistics

Currently statistics requests fail with type errors.
It causes by the fact that pymongo returns bson.Int64
instead of float or int for big nums. It affects a `cpu`
meter usually.

Change-Id: I744a9f79a4bbc3b2ecdd73c126b0859f3f8a733c
Closes-bug: #1532661
(cherry picked from commit 1d73a6f12f123743e51674b5dbc876bf3d600cd8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/23/304223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FINALIZE_FLOAT_LAMBDA = lambda result, param=None: float(result) FINALIZE_INT_LAMBDA = lambda result, param=None: int(result) self._finalize = finalize or FINALIZE_FLOAT_LAMBDA {"sum": "$sum"}, )) {"avg": "$avg"}, )) {"min": "$min"}, )) {"max": "$max"}, )) {"count": "$count"}, FINALIZE_INT_LAMBDA))

commit_message:
Dynamically determine whether Neutron Agents should be enabled

Both the Nuage and PLUMgrid configuration guides advocate overwriting
the entire neutron_services dict in order to disable the DHCP,
Metadata and LinuxBridge Agents. This method is prone to error and
should ideally be more dynamic.

This patch implements a more dynamic approach based on the
neutron_plugin_type and the neutron_ml2_mechanism_drivers that are
set.

This will hopefully simplify the configuration of these and other
ML2 mechanisms (eg: openvswitch) when they're implemented.

Change-Id: I38e1fad4dfae24b32f4370b3da16561c42cd670d
(cherry picked from commit 56cff84860934af714c15388523b25b6cfd5e31c)

added_lines: service_en: "{{ neutron_dhcp | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_linuxbridge | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_metadata | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_metering | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_l3 | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_lbaas | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_lbaasv2 | bool }}" service_en: "{{ neutron_vpnaas | bool }}"## Neutron DHCP Agent neutron_dhcp: "{% if neutron_plugin_type == 'ml2' %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" ## Neutron Metadata Agent neutron_metadata: "{% if neutron_plugin_type == 'ml2' %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" ## Neutron LinuxBridge Agent neutron_linuxbridge: "{% if neutron_plugin_type == 'ml2' and 'linuxbridge' in neutron_ml2_mechanism_drivers %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"

Remove 40X and 50X from Normal response codes

This patch removes them from api-ref.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

commit_message:
Refactor main inventory function for testability

This change alters the dynamic_inventory.py file's main function with
two main changes:

    * main now accepts arguments, which could be the ArgParse parsed
      arguments or a plain dictionary for testing
    * return output to then be printed, instead of just printing.

With these changes, testing inventory can now be done via Python imports
rather than a subprocess call. This make existing tests more clear, and
allows for using pdb when creating future patches. With the subprocess
method, a pdb in the dynamic_inventory.py would cause the test suite to
hang, since the subprocess was waiting for input.

Existing functionality is *not* changed - arguments and output are
simply being moved to make the code easier to test.

Change-Id: I3629c9d0704a7412832d7e898463d376b4e13317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/47/308047/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: inventory_string = di.main({'config': TARGET_DIR}) with self.assertRaises(SystemExit) as context: self.assertTrue(expectedLog in context.exception.message) with self.assertRaises(SystemExit) as context: expectedLog = "global_overrides can't be found in user config" self.assertEqual(context.exception.message, expectedLog)
deleted_lines: cmd = [INV_SCRIPT, '--config', TARGET_DIR] inventory_string = subprocess.check_output( cmd, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT ) with self.assertRaises(subprocess.CalledProcessError) as context: self.assertTrue(expectedLog in context.exception.output) with self.assertRaises(subprocess.CalledProcessError) as context: expectedLog = "global_overrides can't be found in user config\n" self.assertEqual(context.exception.output, expectedLog)

commit_message:
Release oslo.db 1.7.5

oslo.db 1.7.4 has an uncapped dependandcy on testresources.
testresources 2.0.0 rlease recently causes a version conflict with PBR.

global-requirements have been fixed, this release of oslo.db only
contains requirements updates:

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.7.4..90db440d033f768c916fb3a16ba10c2d1ed193f5
90db440 Manual g-r sync
5501224 Updated from global requirements

Change-Id: I6f3e68f6482946b35d8c6f8bb3ed4ca59c8a77e9
Related-Bug: 1572417
Depends-On: I9d8ce19bac0a62404b53cb099a17f7b71a3c3ad2

commit_message:
Add coverage reporting to inventory testing

Using the coverage report will show how much of the dynamic_inventory.py
script is actually exercised by tests. As of this commit, there is no
enforced coverage level, rather it is used for informational purposes
only. In the future, an enforce coverage percentage would be a good
idea.

Change-Id: Ic2ccc9ae5f306465b6990d935c82f81bb7b7956a

commit_message:
Move db query to fetch down bindings under try/except

In case of intermittent DB failures router and network auto-rescheduling
tasks may fail due to error on fetching down bindings from db.
Need to put this queries under try/except to prevent unexpected exit.

Closes-Bug: #1546110
Change-Id: Id48e899a5b3d906c6d1da4d03923bdda2681cd92
(cherry picked from commit b6ec40cbf754de9d189f843cbddfca67d4103ee3)

commit_message:
SSH: Do not rely on the .closed attribute

This patch is updating the logic in the SSH module to not rely on the
"closed" attribute of the channel object when polling the data. The
"closed" attribute may not set to True as part of the exec_command()
execution stack and in that case would cause the exec_command() (from
the tempest SSH module) to hang.

This patch also uses the context manager when creating the channel so
it gets properly closed at the end of the execution scope.

Closes-Bug: #1571492
Change-Id: I5169faf25c36cfb494c9c1fafb14fb4f7f82cd9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/307952/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix data filtering with pagination
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 05:18:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/1e0fab62c3a4c650ea22f18d96bb24712e185864', 'message': '(WIP) Fix data filtering with pagination

When filtering on recordsets data (e.g. IP address) with
pagination, the results are incomlete. This patch fixes
the problem.

Change-Id: Ib06dd288d129ff4b39c388d80f24d179c6af28d8
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-30 05:28:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/2eda9290aaef089e7f7a85b4c9e5323784661c47', 'message': '(WIP) Fix data filtering with pagination

When filtering on recordsets data (e.g. IP address) with
pagination, the results are incomplete. This patch fixes
the problem.

Closes-bug: #1561746
Change-Id: Ib06dd288d129ff4b39c388d80f24d179c6af28d8
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-11 22:23:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/4842eeeb447444b9adce75e2e4e8d47cf1f8ce31', 'message': 'Fix data filtering with pagination

When listing recordsets with filtering on record data,
designate makes a first filtering against recordsets table
to retrieve a list of recordsets belonging to the specified
zone, followed by the second filtering against records table
on record data (e.g. IPs), then intersects the two.
Check https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/api/v2/controllers/recordsets.py

This approach does not work properly when pagination happens.
Imagine a zone has 21 A records with 10.* like IPs,
and 9 A records with 192.* like IPs. When requesting
"/v2/zone/{zone_id}/recordsets?data=10.*", designate makes
the first filtering and get the first page (i.e. 20 recordsets) which may
have both 192.* and 10.* records mixed together,
the second filtering actually excludes all 192.* records from the first page.
But that ends up with a page less than 20 records, so designate wont
include a next link in the response.

This patch fixes the problem.

Closes-bug: #1561746
Change-Id: Ib06dd288d129ff4b39c388d80f24d179c6af28d8
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-13 02:30:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/7f7481e34bbf6dda2cfa9b8cfc8acca63d218af9', 'message': 'Fix data filtering with pagination

When listing recordsets with filtering on record data,
designate makes a first filtering against recordsets table
to retrieve a list of recordsets belonging to the specified
zone, followed by the second filtering against records table
on record data (e.g. IPs), then intersects the two.
Check https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/api/v2/controllers/recordsets.py

This approach does not work properly when pagination happens.
Imagine a zone has 21 A records with 10.* like IPs,
and 9 A records with 192.* like IPs. When requesting
"/v2/zone/{zone_id}/recordsets?data=10.*", designate makes
the first filtering and get the first page (i.e. 20 recordsets) which may
have both 192.* and 10.* records mixed together,
the second filtering actually excludes all 192.* records from the first page.
But that ends up with a page less than 20 records, so designate wont
include a next link in the response.

This patch fixes the problem.

commit_message:
Fix data filtering with pagination

When listing recordsets with filtering on record data,
designate makes a first filtering against recordsets table
to retrieve a list of recordsets belonging to the specified
zone, followed by the second filtering against records table
on record data (e.g. IPs), then intersects the two.
Check https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/api/v2/controllers/recordsets.py

This approach does not work properly when pagination happens.
Imagine a zone has 21 A records with 10.* like IPs,
and 9 A records with 192.* like IPs. When requesting
"/v2/zone/{zone_id}/recordsets?data=10.*", designate makes
the first filtering and get the first page (i.e. 20 recordsets) which may
have both 192.* and 10.* records mixed together,
the second filtering actually excludes all 192.* records from the first page.
But that ends up with a page less than 20 records, so designate won't
include a 'next' link in the response.

This patch fixes the problem.

Closes-bug: #1561746
Change-Id: Ib06dd288d129ff4b39c388d80f24d179c6af28d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/25/299125/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Force container builds to use http.us.debian.org

httpredir has multiple mirrors behind it, meaning on any given build
we're relying on several mirrors to all stay up at the same time. This
happens much less often than we'd like.

By forcing this to http.us.debian.org, we're using a more curated set of
mirrors which are less likely to be flakey.

The long term fix is to use a debian mirror provided by infra for
check/gate builds, but until that exists this should help.

Depends-on: I5169faf25c36cfb494c9c1fafb14fb4f7f82cd9e
Related-bug: #1571829
Change-Id: Ia7ea8d909df9ae86a6dbd68ba94746b171535eb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/74/307474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure we hit a single mirror for builds, since httpredir is flakey RUN sed -i 's/httpredir/http.us/g' /etc/apt/sources.list RUN echo 'deb http://http.us.debian.org/debian jessie-backports main' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/backports.list
